abstract.text: Obtains per-mechanism information about a credential.

inlineContent.text: A pointer to the secondary status result that provides additional information in case of failure.
The credential to inspect. Use
to inquire about the default initiator principal.
The mechanism for which information should be returned.
A pointer the function uses to return the name that the credential asserts. Use
to free the name  object’s memory when you are done with it. Set the parameter to
to ignore this output.

A pointer the function uses to return the number of seconds for which the credential will remain valid for initiating security contexts, or 0 if the credential is expired or if the credential’s usage mechanism is
. For credentials that do not support expiry, the function returns
. Set to
to ignore this output.

A pointer the function uses to return the number of seconds for which the credential will remain valid for accepting security contexts, or 0 if the credential is expired or if the credential’s usage mechanism is
. For credentials that do not support expiry, the function returns
. Set to
to ignore this output.
A pointer the function uses to return the credential usage. The value is one of
, or
. Set to
to ignore this output.
A status code set to
on success. See
for a description of other status outputs.

abstract.text: Conduct secure, authenticated network transactions.
Returns the remaining time in seconds before the credential expires.
The value that indicates a credential that can accept a security context.
The value that indicates a credential that can both initiate and accept security contexts.
The value that indicates the maximum permitted lifetime when used in a time request.
The value that indicates a credential that can initiate a security context.
The value that indicates an empty credential object.
The operation completed without error.
A 32-bit unsigned integer.
Evaluate return values that most GSS-API functions use to indicate the outcome of an operation.
A pointer to the OID descriptor that exchanges object identifiers with many GSS-API functions.
A pointer to an opaque type that you use to exchange a credential object with GSS-API functions.
A credential usage value.
Obtains information about a credential.
Obtains per-mechanism information about a credential.
Inquires about a particular characteristic of a credential.
A pointer to an opaque type that you use to communicate name objects with GSS-API functions.
Frees the resources associated with a name object.
A pointer for accessing and manipulating data of a specific type.
